result.execSummary:
The defendant Stuart K. Kramer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be repaid in monthly increments of no less than $75.00 starting December 1, 2014. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant is prohibited  from engaging in any further violent and/or confrontational contact with H. Hoffman.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to complete an Anger Managment Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Cases called @ 3:44 p.m. Defendant Stuart K. Kramer in court with attorney Alex E. Johnson.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant previously entered pleas in all matters. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Johnson. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 yrs probation as to all cases concurrent - Conditions: 14CF85 only - 30 days WCJ - Huber, No GT, 7 days CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than December 1, 2014, As to all matters - AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Anger Managment, Restitution in the amount of $483.73 to be repaid in increments of no less than $75 monthly starting December 1, 2014, N/C/C w/ H. Hoffman, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
from victim H.H. with statement regarding sentencing
Sentencing hearing on October 17, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

14CF-85, 14CM-188 and 14CM-201 - All Cases Called @ 3:13 PM: Defendant Stuart K. Kramer in court with attorney Alex E. Johnson.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Matters to proceed to plea today with bifurcated sentencing date.  Global resolution recited by ADA with expected argued terms on sentencing.  Def and counsel concur w/recital.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.   14CF-85:  Amended charge to Battery and 14CM-188/14CM-201 elements of offenses recited.   Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's Motion to Amend as to 14CF-85 Ct 1 to Battery, contrary to 941.19(1) Class A Misd Plea: NC.  14CM-188 Ct 1 - Violation of TRO - Plea:  NC.  14CM-201 Ct 1 - Violation of TRO - Plea:  NC.   Court accepts all pleas and enters JOC as to each charge.  Court dismisses outright the Repeater Enhancers as to each case.  Also DRI is uncharged referral for violation of TRO with a violation date of 4/18/14 from Plainfield PD, case 14PP00183.  SEH adjourned.  Defendant advised that bond will continue to and until sentencing and consequences for violating terms of bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

14CF85, 14CM188 & 14CM201 Cases called @ 3:04 p.m. Defendant Stuart K. Kramer in court with attorney Alex E. Johnson.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Johnson - the defendant is requesting a court trial on 14CF85 and will waive his right to a jury trial. There may be possible resolution to the other matters. 14CF85 only - The court entertains waiver of the right to a jury trial. The court accepts voluntary waiver of a jury trial. ADA Anderson stipulates to a waiver of a jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Court trial scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Restitution Summary - $483.73

Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety. Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed.   Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  STC Scheduled as to all matters - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
